annual crop land: possibly farm equipment or irrigation systems
uniformity in the type of vegetation being grown
usually free of large trees or permanent structures
forest: wildlife such as birds, insects, or mammals
varying shades of green leaves or foliage
pattern of light and shadow due to the canopy above
presence of underbrush or ground vegetation
possibly features like streams or rivers
brushland or shrubland: may have grassy areas interspersed with shrubs
subject to seasonal changes in appearance, with stress indicating rainfall patterns
sparse or scattered distribution of shrubs or small trees
highway or road: road markings indicating crosswalks or turn lanes
vehicles, such as cars, trucks, or motorcycles
absence of vegetation in the primary travel paths

multiple windows, often large (common in commercial buildings)

absence of crop rotation or seasonal changes

walls with siding, brick, or other exterior finishes

reflections of the sky or surrounding landscape
